user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of reply_with_main_page:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
reply_with_main_page (struct MHD_Connection *c)
{
  static const char page_content[] = MAIN_PAGE;
  static const size_t page_content_len =
    (sizeof(page_content) / sizeof(char)) - 1;
  struct MHD_Response *resp;
  enum MHD_Result ret;

  resp = MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static (page_content_len, page_content)
  ;
  if (NULL == resp)
    return MHD_NO;

  /* Ignore possible error when adding the header as the reply will work even
     without this header. */
  (void) MHD_add_response_header (resp,
                                  MHD_HTTP_HEADER_CONTENT_TYPE,
                                  "text/html");

  ret = MHD_queue_response (c, MHD_HTTP_OK, resp);
  MHD_destroy_response (resp);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No compiler language extensions are used in the provided code fragment. I checked for common non-standard/implementation-specific constructs (and found none):
- No compiler-specific keywords or attributes such as __attribute__, __declspec, __asm__, __builtin_*, __extension__, or __typeof__.
- No GCC/Clang statement expressions ({ ... }) or nested functions.
- No inline assembly or other vendor-specific intrinsics.
- No use of non-standard storage-class or type qualifiers beyond standard C (static, const, enum, struct).
- The (void) cast of the function return is standard C to explicitly discard a value.
- Use of sizeof, array declaration with inferred size from initializer, enum types, and pointer usage are all standard C.

The only identifiers that could be macros or types coming from external libraries (MAIN_PAGE, MHD_create_response_from_buffer_static, MHD_* types/constants) are library symbols; their definitions are not shown. If any of those definitions use compiler extensions, that would need to be inspected in their respective headers/definitions. Based solely on the shown code, there are no language extensions to report.
